title: What if Sejuani had Lee Sin's pick rate and winrate? ( 35% PR and 51% WR)
body:
My bet is that Riot would knee cap her so hard that you wouldn't be able to play her consistently for the rest of the 2017 season. Cut the bias and nerf this little shit.

EDIT: I only make this comparison because a Rioter had once said "Sejuani has had her time in the spotlight, its time for another champion to have her spotlight" Sejuani was strong for 1 patch, got nerfed and her core item got nerfed and she was placed back into the gutter where she was previous. Meanwhile Lee Sin, has been strong/overbearing for MANY patches, SEASONS even, still not a nerf in sight. If Riot wants people to take this game seriously as a competitive e-sport, they need to cut the bullshit and stop playing favorites. Balance should have no favorites, if you're overtuned you deserve nerfs, if you're undertuned, you need buffs, regardless of who the champion is.

A game where those champions are not nearly as binary as Mordekaiser was (and sadly still is, though not to the same extent) nor as completely lacking in meaningful counterplay or interactivity. 

Mordekaiser is more healthy now than he was before the rework. He's still a toxic piece of shit, but less so.

Riven as a character is basically entirely predicated not on you making a mistake as the person playing against her but capitalizing on her player screwing up. At least Mordekaiser's binary nature made his counterplay simple - Riven's counterplay is "never be near her but also don't let her farm so she won't oneshot 5 people and also don't get too far behind or she'll just tower dive you", lol.

So you want to rework him and remove aspects of his kit just because?

I mean, that's like, counterproductive to the rework design... they rework champions because they're too binary/have absolutely no counterplay, not because they're too versatile at any given moment.

Not just because - because he's too versatile. He offers literally everything a diver would want, so he's a universal pick unless his numbers are low enough, and then he's shit. Meddler's talked about reworking Kalista and Azir because they're also generalist champions that are universally good. 

So it's not that I want stuff removed from his kit just because - I want things removed so he has an identity beyond "the champ that does everything"

The issue is Lee doesn't excel at anything. There's usually always a stronger pick you can take for what you want to accomplish, because he's a generalist pick - in the sense of the jungle, he's only really far above average at one thing: applying early pressure. And this is *because* of his generalist-type nature: he's basically on the opposite spectrum of Elise in terms of _why_ he succeeds early. (Mainly because Elise specializes in early pressure with ridiculous base damages, crowd control, and insane dive potential to **brute force** these ganks, while Lee succeeds off the versatility of his kit which allows him to make pressure happen from many different situations)

Also, his kit is kinda designed to allow him to strongly impact early and dial down slowly as the game goes on from there. (For example, the shield on Safeguard isn't quite too relevant if he's diving to inSec someone as he doesn't get the shield when he hops to a ward, and the effects of Cripple (his 2nd E) aren't as useful because the slow isn't as impactful as it is early game. The two consistencies are his Q execute and his ult - but those are what define Lee Sin.) 

My only complaint with Lee is that his R has a stun attached to it - so you can't do anything about it - but it doesn't stun him as well. Other than that, he does have his purpose (all around flexible jungler, strong early and scales decently but not anything to be noted but has decent initiation potential). (Also, I'm saying either make his R stun him (remove R -> Flash) or remove the stun on his R before it hits...)

(Also, the Lethality changes really hit his ability to snowball with damage items, especially since Ghostblade was one of his better items for that.)

At least he has to make a choice in terms of whether he wants to build tank or damage to get one or the other. Unlike certain other champions which build tank items, have strong early games, and maybe build one damage item to 100-0 your entire backline with a spell rotation... I think there are many "specialist" picks that need proper changes before Lee Sin needs something to tune him into a specialist.
(Namely Hecarim, but Courage of the Colossus needs changes too.)

That is exactly the problem: Lee Sin is a generalist. And generalists are considered a problem by Riot. They are actively keeping Lucian weak right now, do you know why? They gave a class update to marksmen, giving each of them an unique niche and playstyle. Lucian wasn't included and right now he is a generalist. Riot stated that if Lucian is actually strong, he dominates the adc role and they don't want that to happen.

The same is going on with Lee Sin right now. He is a generalist jungler and he is strong, he is actually dominating the jungle because of that. That is a problem. I hope they are doing something about it with the upcoming diver class update, we have to see. But don't act like being a generalist is no problem at all....

I feel though with Lucian that he's not just a generalist in that nature - he's actively one of the strongest, if not the strongest, lane bully in the game when he has good itemization. Maybe Lee is the same way (I really don't think so, however, because I feel every time his itemization is good, someone else benefits a bit more).

So he's a generalist while being a master of lane bullying. 

Also, Lee isn't dominating the jungle. He has a huge pick rate but his winrate is nothing special - if he had a higher winrate it'd be much more concerning... but his winrate even at 125+ games flatlines at 52%. That's honestly not that bad for a veteran jungle status.

It isn't about lane bullying, though. If you are a generalist, that means you are good at many different tasks. That's the case for Lucian and that is exactly why he can't be strong. If he is strong, that means there is no reason to pick another adc. Because he is strong and good at many different things at once.

There is something like "too versatile" in that game and the goal is to give each champion a unique niche in that game. If someone is pretty good at everything (not the best, he just has to be good), there is no reason to pick someone else.

I'd be fine with his ratios being shifted to TAD ratios, at a much lower value.
